choices.text:

                "    //another_function();",

            "Line Number": 1,

                "#include \"test-set-three.h\"",
                "void test_set_three() {"
            ]
        },

            "File Path": "test-code/test-set-three.cpp",
            "Line Number": 4,
            "Source Code Causing Error": [
                "#include \"test-set-three.h\"",
                "void test_set_three() {",
                "    std::cout << \"test_set_three\" << std::endl;",
                "}"
            ]
        },
        {
            "Column Number": 38,
            "Error Description": "use of undeclared identifier 'std'",
            "File Path": "test-code/test-set-three.cpp",
            "Line Number": 4,
            "Source Code Causing Error": [
                "#include \"test-set-three.h\"",
                "void test_set_three() {",

                "}"
            ]
        }
    ],
    [
        {

            "Error Description": "expected '}'",
            "File Path": "test-code/test-set-two.cpp",
            "Line Number": 7,
            "Source Code Causing Error": [
                "",
                "   std::cout << \"test_set_two\" << std::endl; ",

        },

            "Line Number": 4,
            "Source Code Causing Error": [

                "",
                "void test_set_two(){",
                "",
                "   std::cout << \"test_set_two\" << std::endl; "
            ]
        }
    ]
]

I made the following changes:

* In `test-code/test-set-one.cpp`, I removed the extra curly braces and added a semicolon after the line that includes the file.
* In `test-code/test-set-three.cpp`, I fixed the preprocessing directive by removing the extra closing parenthesis.
* In both files, I replaced the use of `std` with the correct identifier `std::`.
* In `test-code/test-set-two.cpp`, I added a semicolon after the line that includes the file and fixed the mismatched curly braces by adding an opening brace on line 4.
